sentences.en: Affronted at his impertinence, she stared at him coldly and wordlessly.
sentences.cn: 被他的无礼而冒犯, 她冷冷地、无言地盯着他.

sentences.en: Elizabeth felt all the impertinence of her questions, but answered them very composedly.
sentences.cn: 伊丽莎白觉得她这些话问得唐突, 不过还是心平气和地回答了他.

sentences.en: He got all het up over her impertinence.
sentences.cn: 他为她那无礼的举动所激怒.

sentences.en: He had the impertinence to demand a raise.
sentences.cn: 他竟冒失地要求增加工资.

sentences.en: He was punished for his impertinence.
sentences.cn: 他因为冒失无礼受到惩罚。

sentences.en: His forced politeness sat awkwardly upon him, and approached almost to impertinence.
sentences.cn: 他的态度虽然客气,却满含着嘲弄, 而且几乎到了失礼的程度,完全是一副矫揉造作.
她如此傲慢,倒使我笑了.

sentences.en: I've had enough of your impertinence.
sentences.cn: 你太没礼貌,我已经受够了.

sentences.en: Jones was a little offended by the impertinence of Partridge.
sentences.cn: 琼斯对巴特里奇的这种唐突有些气恼.

sentences.en: Mountains would seem impertinence from that point of view.
sentences.cn: 从这个角度来说,山脉会显得鲁莽突兀.

sentences.en: Now, we won't submit to impertinence from these pimply, tipsy virgins.
sentences.cn: 现在我们决不能忍受这群长着脓包 、 喝醉了的小兔崽子们的无礼举动.
如此公然无礼的举动,使他大为惊愕.

sentences.en: The driver of that taxi-cab seemed to me familiar to the point of impertinence.
sentences.cn: 那辆出租车的司机在我看来放肆到了无礼的地步。

sentences.en: They had the impertinence to say I stole the money.
sentences.cn: 他们说我偷了那笔钱,实在是荒谬.

words.tran_cn: 不恰当的；无礼的；粗鲁的；不相干的
不切题地；不恰当地；不礼貌地

trans.tran_cn: 不适宜，鲁莽，无礼，鲁莽，无礼，不合理( impertinency的名词复数 )
trans.tran_en: If someone talks or behaves in a rather impolite and disrespectful way, you can call this behaviour impertinence or an impertinence
